description: From millenarian +â€Ž -ism. Compare millenarism, millennianism, millennialism.

entries.meaning: A belief in a coming religious millennium, especially (Christianity) the belief in a coming thousand-year reign of peace heralded by the Second Coming of Christ; utopianism, belief in a coming era of peace and prosperity. [from 19th c.]
examples: It is hard to say for certain just why this brief but notable shift from passive to active millenarianism should have occurred during the Interregnum.
